sentences.english: However, it stands by its decision not to nominate him for the Coach of the Year award.
sentences.chinese: 坚持不提名他竞逐最佳教练的荣衔。

sentences.english: The incumbent and the rising powers compete for dominance.
sentences.chinese: 老牌大国和新兴大国竞逐主导地位。

sentences.english: Tang and Leung should have two kinds of benign interactions.
sentences.chinese: 至于良性互动，在唐梁竞逐中有两个层面。

definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
to win the laurels/to pass an imperial examination/to win a championship
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
